title: SB 1.19.20 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 23-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम ज्ञान तिमिरान्धस्य ज्ञानाञ्जनिषलाकया चक्षरुन्मीलितं येनतस्मैं श्री गुरवे नमः नमाः ओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गवरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने जाय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभूनित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधरा श्रीवासादी गवरभक्त वृन्दा
हरे कृष्णा, हरे कृष्णा, कृष्ट कृष्णा, हरे हरे, हरे राम, हरे राम, राम राम, हरे हरे, ओम नमो भगवते वासु देवाया, नारायणम नमस्कृत्य, नरमचेवनरोत्तमम, देवीम सरस्वतीम व्यासम ततो जयमुदी रयेत।
इन इस सेशन विदिस्कसिंग फ्रॉम दे ट्वेंटीयत् वर्स अब दे नाइन्टीम् चैप्टर ओव दी फर्स्ट कैंटो श्रीमद्भागवतम।
सद्यो जहुर भगवत पार्श्वकामाह।
The meaning of this verses, the sages said,
O chief of all the saintly kings of the Pandu dynasty who are strictly in the line of Lord Sri Krishna,
it is not at all astonishing that you give up your throne which is decorated with the helmets of many kings
kings to achieve eternal association with the personality of Godhead this is
the praise of this assembled saintly persons with regard to purchase action
of renouncing his kingdom and coming to this holy place to prepare himself to go
back to Godhead by fasting unto death so an elaborate purport is given by
Srila Prabhupada explaining this appreciation of the saintly persons of
purchase action so Srila Prabhupada says in the purport foolish politicians who
hold political administrative force think that the temporary post they
occupy are the highest material gain of life and therefore they stick to those
posts even up to the last moment of life without knowing that achievement of
liberation as one of the associates of the Lord in his eternal abode is the
highest gain of life here Prabhupada is comparing modern-day politicians who are
those who are ignorant about spiritual reality
they think that to hold some very high position in this material world even
though it is a temporary position they think that the post they occupy is the
highest gain of their life and they stick on to that position till they
are forced to leave that by being forced to die quit the body and they
are ignorant of the fact that they are not the body their spirit soul therefore
after quitting the body at the time of death they have to enter another body
that they are not aware
but if they know about spiritual reality then they understand there is
something much much much much greater to be obtained in this human form of
life by practicing Krishna consciousness and achieving liberation to become one
of the associates of the Supreme Lord in his personal abode in the spiritual
world that they do not know
so Srila Prabhupada says in the purport further the human life is meant for achieving
this end this is the goal of human life the Lord has assured us in the Bhagavad Gita
many times that going back to Godhead his eternal abode is the highest achievement
yad gatva nani vartante tad dhama paramam mama
ah
madh karmakrana madh paramo madh bhaktasangavarjitah nirvaira sarvabhuteshu yassa mameti
pandava
yaktvadeham punarjanmaneti mameti sorjuna
so many places in the Bhagavad Gita Krishna is talking about this further Srila Prabhupada
says
Prahlad Maharaj while praying to Lord Narasimha said oh my Lord I am very much afraid of
the materialistic way of life Prahlad Maharaj is a pure devotee actually he is fearless
but still he is teaching us by telling that he is very much afraid of the materialistic
way of life and he further says I am not the least afraid of your present ghastly
ferocious feature as Nrsimha Deva. Well, Lord Nrsimha appeared to protect Prahlad Maharaj against his
demoniac father. Nrsimha was very very very angry. Against whom was he angry? He was angry against
Hiranyakashyapu. He was never angry at Prahlad and Prahlad knew this. Therefore, Prahlad is
telling Lord Nrsimha, I am not afraid of your ferocious form. Because that ferocious form is
meant for protecting the devotee. He is meant to chastise the non-devotee atheist, demon,
that the devotee is confident. And Prahlad Maharaj is telling why is he afraid of materialistic
way of life. He is telling this materialistic way of life is something like a grinding stone and we
are being crushed by it. See foolish people don't realize that taking birth in the material world
means accepting a material body.
And this material body is subject to so many miseries under the influence of these three gunas
which are constantly harassing us in the form of different kinds of miseries being
inflicted against our being- vishnu. Adi bhautika klesha, adhyatmika klesha, adi daivika klesha,
adi bhautika kess wastewater, abhyatmika klesha, vishulya, and any kunti and any sort of
dem Dievikal klesha. They don't want us to face the agenda beyond our awareness and control.
In the form of different kinds of miseries being inflicted against our wish. Adi bhautika klesha
Adi spiritually 大以上的外外. And balanced by that divine nature and grit.

constantly being harassed by this so Prahlad Maharaj is giving an analogy it's something like being crushed in a grinding stone continuously and another example Prahlad is giving here when praying to Narasimha Deva he is telling we have fallen into this horrible whirlpool of the tossing waves of life
my lord I pray at your lotus feet to call me back to your eternal abode as one of your servitors
another example Prahlad is giving suppose somebody is who's meant to live on the land falls into the middle of the ocean
then ocean means continuously there are waves and these waves will toss the person
up and down up and down so it will be a struggle to keep himself afloat
because continuously waves will be coming and trying to overpower the person
who has to protect himself against being drowned by those waves
so in a similar way
through this
Prahlad is telling this material world we are drowning in the waves of the
attacked by Maya in the form of continuous miseries being inflicted through the gunas
instead Prahlad Maharaj is praying to the lord please call me back to your eternal abode as one of your servants
Prahlad further says this is the summit liberation of the materialistic way of life

if at all you want freedom from the suffering of this world then you should simply aim to become one of the eternal associates of the supreme lord in his personal abode as his loving devotional servitor
that is what Prahlad Maharaj is teaching in this prayer
and what is Pariksit praying for
he is also preparing to go back to the spiritual world to become one of the associates of the supreme lord
further Prahlad is telling I have very bitter experience of the materialistic way of life
he has already said it is like a grinding stone in which we are getting crushed or like falling into a rock
or like falling into a rock
or like falling into a middle of the ocean being tossed by the waves continuously
now further he is telling the bitter experience he has had in this material world
what is that
in whichever species of life I have taken birth compelled by the force of my own activities
I have very painfully experienced two things
this is common for everyone not just for Prahlad
please hear carefully
two things that everyone is experiencing which they don't realize
what are the two things
separation from my beloved
who is our beloved
our beloved is the supreme lord Krishna
in the material world we are separated from him
and the second thing is
we all experience meeting with what is not wanted
unwanted miseries are forced upon us
in this material existence
and further Prahlad says
to counteract these unwanted miseries
the remedies which I undertook were more dangerous than the disease itself
we are suffering from a disease called bhava roga
bhava roga
and material means to counteract this bhava roga
are worse than suffering the disease of bhava roga itself
so I drift from one point to another birth after birth
the misery doesn't stop simply by
giving up one body
thinking that my suffering will be
coming to an end when I quit the body
just like when somebody is suffering too much
they wish that they die rather than live
especially somebody who has got a terminal illness
chronic disease
they cannot tolerate the suffering
and they wish and pray that I may die
but death is not the solution because they are going to take birth again
and taking birth again without preparing to go back to god
it means one more material body
and again that material body also
under the clutches of maya they are going to suffer similarly
therefore Prahlad is concluding the prayer by telling
I pray to you therefore to give me shelter at your lotus feet
I don't want to be under the clutches of maya
that's what Prahlad is telling
now Srila Prabhupada continues
by telling
the Pandava kings who are more than many saints of the world
knew the bitter results of materialistic way of life
they were never captivated by
the glare of the imperial throne they occupied
they were very very powerful
they were emperors of the world
entire world
very powerful
but they were not captivated by some
allurement of maya
therefore they always sought
the opportunity being called by the lord
to associate with him eternally
they were just waiting
as long as the lord wants us to rule this world
we will rule
but when he calls us back
we are ready to go
for eternal life there
so this is temporary
material existence is temporary
so Maharaj Pariksha said that
so Maharaj Pariksha was the worthy grandson of Maharaj Yudhishtira
so just like Maharaj Yudhishtira gave up the imperial throne to his grandson
who is his grandson
Pariksha
similarly
Pariksha gave up the imperial throne to his son Janame Jaya
that is the way
of all the kings in the dynasty
they are all strictly in the line of Lord Krishna
that is what is described in this verse
by the sages
all the kings in these
saintly
dynasty of saintly kings
Rajarshi
Parampara
Krishna says
evam parampara praptam imam rajarsha yo viduh
the saintly kings
they strictly follow
the instructions of Krishna
they don't permanently hold on to any post
in the material world
so they live
unattached to all the objects of materialistic way of life
they never are attached
so giving up is very easy for them
and giving up for what
for spiritual life
I will stop here
thank you very much
Hare Krishna
